page.title: 11The Ditton Club
page.content: Ditton Club was founded as "Ditton & Neighbouring Parishes' Working Men's Club" in 1887. The objectives of the club, as stated in the Rule Book, are "to afford to its members the means of social intercourse,mutual helpfulness, mental and moral improvement and rational recreation." Nowadays, facilities are available for playing Cribbage, Euchre, Whist, Darts, Pool Dominoes, Shove Ha'penny and Bingo, whilst for the youngsters there are video machines and discos. More adult groups play on Saturday nights. At Christmas there is a children's party, at Easter a Bonnet Parade and at Halloween a Fancy Dress competition. Outings to race meetings take place and the Club won the competition for the best float on "Funday" in 1985.
